data.title: Alan Alda: 12 interesting facts about the actor
data.meta_description: Check out our slideshow to learn some interesting facts about celebrity Alan Alda.
data.text:
Best known for his starring role as Captain Benjamin Franklin 'Hawkeye' Pierce, actor Alan Alda is still going strong in his 80s.

Learn more about Alda's background and career in our latest Celebrity Fun Facts slideshow.

12 things you might not know about Alan Alda

By Mike Rose, cleveland.com

January 27, 2017

Click on to learn more about Alan Alda who celebrates his birthday tomorrow.

A New York state of mind

Alan Alda was born in the Bronx on January 28, 1936. His birth name is Alphonso Joseph D’Abruzzo.

(Photo: Associated Press)

The family business

Alda’s father, Robert Alda, was a respected actor in film and on Broadway. His half-brother Antony Alda was also an actor and director.

(Photo: Associated Press)

Life on stage and screen

Alda is best known for reprising Donald Sutherland’s role of Captain Benjamin Franklin 'Hawkeye' Pierce on 'MASH' but is also known for roles on 'ER' and 'The West Wing'

(Photo: Associated Press)

A Cleveland connection

Alda was part of the acting company for the Cleveland Play House in the late fifties.

(Photos: CPH and Plain Dealer file photos)

Mr. president?

Before the role went to Martin Sheen, Alda was originally considered for the lead role in 'The West Wing'

(Photos: Associated Press)

A record-setting performance

In addition to being the only actor to appear in all 251 episodes of 'MASH', Alda directed 32 episodes of the show and had writing credits on 19 episodes.

(Photo: Associated Press)

Hooray for Hollywood

Alan has many film acting credits to his name including Woody Allen’s 'Manhattan Murder Mystery’ and Michael’ Moore’s ‘Canadian Bacon’

(Photos: Associated Press)

A fan of public television

Alda served as the host of the PBS series 'Scientific American Frontiers’ for many years.

(Photo: Associated Press)

An award-winner

Alda has been nominated at least once for each EGOT category including his Oscar nomination for ‘The Aviator’. He has 21 Emmy nominations and won 5 times.

(Photo: Associated Press)

Almost 'Super'

IMDB reports that Alda also was considered for a lead role in 'Superman III' that eventually went to Robert Vaughn.

(Photos: Associated Press)

Professor Alda

Alda is listed as a visiting professor at Stony Brook University where he is on the board of the Alan Alda Center for Communicating Science.

Foreign correspondent

Alda is a fan of cosmology and worked for the BBC during coverage of the opening of the Large Hadron Collider in Geneva.

(Photo: Associated Press)

Photos: Associated Press
